info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued November 27 at 3:30AM HST until November 28 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY THROUGH EARLY MONDAY MORNING FOR NORTH AND EAST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU MOLOKAI AND MAUI AND FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF THE BIG ISLAND... .A large north-northeast (010-040 degrees) swell will continue to produce elevated, rough surf along most north and east facing shores of the smaller islands. In addition, the north and west facing shores of the Big Island will have elevated surf. This north-northeast swell will gradually lower later tonight. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST MONDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 18 to 22 feet along north facing shores, and waves of 8 to 12 feet along east facing shores. Waves up to 11 feet along west facing shores of the Big Island. * WHERE...North and east facing shores of Kauai, Maui, Molokai, Niihau, and Oahu, and for north and west facing shores of the Big Island. * WHEN...Through early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Strong breaking waves and strong currents will make swimming dangerous.
info.instruction: Head all advice from ocean safety officials. When in doubt, don`t go out.
